metadata.title: CVE-2024-44978 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/xe: Free job before xe_exec_queue_putFree job depends on job->vm being valid, the last xe_exec_queue_put candestroy the VM. Prevent UAF by freeing job before xe_exec_queue_put.(cherry picked from commit 32a42c93b74c8ca6d0915ea3eba21bceff53042f)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-44978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
